strDesc:
Основной элемент в межпланетных строительных проектах, дроны Бейдат являются неутомимыми работниками, способными выполнять точную работу без каких-либо накладных расходов, связанных с зарплатами или соблюдением норм охраны труда и безопасности.

Однако на них лежит репутация чрезвычайно уязвимых. Это часто используется в качестве спорта людьми, которых дроны заменяют.

strNameFriendly: Бейдат "Энфорсер" Тяжёлый Охранный и Строительный Дрон
strDesc:
Разработанный как реакция на постоянные вандализации дронов "Ткач", Бейдат стремился расширить спектр своих автоматизированных рабочих предложений.

Переработав шасси для увеличения веса, заменив хрупкие ноги на гусеничные корпуса, добавив броню и платформу для оружия, а также включив "Охрану" в операционную область дрона, Бейдат добился создания дрона, который вызывает ещё большее презрение.

This Van Buren-engineered injection offers a short-term boost to high-G tolerance, delivered through a single-use subcutaneous injector pen that works through clothes and thin spacesuits.

The medication primarily works maintain adequate cardiac output and alertness to reduce G-LOC and injury under high-G strain.

Liability labels assert the drug is most effective in healthier bodies, but proprietary additives Adrenolux and Hemofoam claim to provide even micro-G adapted bodies some protection, with acceptable levels of post-exposure side effects.

This Van Buren-engineered injection intended to reduce wide spectrum radiation in a living body, delivered through a single-use subcutaneous injector pen that works through clothes and thin spacesuits.

The medication is comprised of a cocktail of Prussian Blue (potassium ferric hexacyanoferrate) and DTPA (Diethylenetriamine pentaacetic acid) binding agents for bodily elimination, potassium iodide for thyroid protection, and the proprietary ChymAdd stem cell stabilizer for high energy exposures.

Typically used daily after radiation exposure. Not effective against cancer and hair loss.

The Kang CDR Series atmosphere scrubber, commonly found on ships as part of the life support system. This device removes CO2 from air through a chemical exothermic reaction of the sorbent lithium hydroxide (LiOH) into lithium carbonate (Li2CO3) and water (H2O). While effective, the process requires nearly daily canister replacement per crew member.

Volatiles are materials that phase shift to gas in ambient atmosphere. They are abundant in space mining and crucial for colony life support and industry, though can be difficult to capture and transport.

Examples include regolith (heated to emit chemically bonded hydrogen, water, He4, etc.), ices (H2O, CO2, or ammonia ice) and liquids (liquid methane or liquid ethane).

One of Testudo Corp's diverse products, this fragrant rice wine is a bit of an in-joke with early shipbreakers.

The legal face and heart of a ship, a transponder (XPDR) transmits identifying signals to other ships, and differentiates friends from foes. Penalties are steep for civilian craft failing to maintain a single active transponder identifying the vessel. This is in part due to the danger of collisions with other vessels, but also since pirates often "fly dark" to avoid notice.

Extremely prone to damage from uninstalling or tampering. Ship must also have a powered 1090MHz antenna installed separately.

The Future Foods Trencher (tm) is a space food staple renowned for its long life and unique flavour. The packaging is a biosolid which is just as technically edible as the contents. 'Trenchers: The joy of eating... replaced by the necessity of sustenance.'

This one is styled 'Acceptable Algae'. It's not just good, It's 'Acceptable'.

This one is styled 'Chipotle Pork with Cheese Spread'. 3 out of 5 taste-testers agree this is what pork and cheese was described as tasting like in an Old Earth book.

This one is styled 'Mystery Meat in Surprise Sauce', which among the line's labelling is probably the most honest.
strNameFriendly: Food: Trenchers Mystery Meat in Surprise Sauce

This one is styled 'Pizza Pouch', a disheartening attempt at encapsulating the Old Earth classic into a space-friendly format. The imitation pineapple doesn't help.

The Future Foods Trencher (tm) is a space food staple renowned for its long life and unique flavour. The packaging is a biosolid which is just as technically edible as the contents. 'Trenchers: The joy of eating... replaced by the necessity of sustenance.'

This one is styled 'Sweet Potato Cake and Garden Salad', a gastronomic paradox that confounds the palate more than it pleases.
strNameFriendly: Food: Trenchers Sweet Potato Cake and Garden Salad

strDesc: Capable of keeping food and other perishables at low temperature, the fridge (when full) is a favorite feature of the ship's galley.

"Peppercorn" is a misnomer, of course, being a meticulously dried berry of the prickly ash tree.

Most famous for its málà flavor profile combining a tingling sensation with spicy numbness, this mystical flavor experience is a decadent, welcomed Hangzhou export.
strNameFriendly: Street Food: Szechuan Beef with Pink Peppercorn

strDesc:
Nigerian-style pepper soup is a spice-forward dish supporting nearly any protein (in this case textured algae).

The spice mix may vary, but the aromatic power comes from roasting the seeds before crushing them.
strNameFriendly: Street Food: Algae Broth in a Bag with Alligator Pepper and Seared Tomatoes

strDesc:
Carbon fiber suya skewers of protein morsels bathed in a classic peanut-based, smoky spice rub.

They're most definitely not chicken, but the best vendors can be surprisingly convincing.
strNameFriendly: Street Food: Kebab of Chicken in a Yaji Spice Rub

strDesc: Hot and delicious spot prawn stir fry in suya curry, wrapped in translucent, edible biosolid foil for convenient carrying and disposal.
strNameFriendly: Street Food: Spot Prawn Curry Stir Fry

strDesc:
Nothing beats good noodles, except maybe noodles made from single cell protein and mealworm powder topped with a dash of Nestégg's famous Herb-and-Dairy Flakes.

Nestégg vehemently disapproves of such a pedestrian use of its flavoring, but that has only reinforced the practice.
strNameFriendly: Street Food: Entomoprotein Noodles with Nestégg Herb-and-Dairy Flakes

strDesc:
These flour-like powder balls rolled with fish-flavored flakes are fried and often smothered in your choice of sweet, sour, spicy, or a mix of sauces.

The chili vinegar sauce is a particular favorite among K-Leg's shipbreakers.
strNameFriendly: Street Food: Chili Vinegar Fish Balls

Only three tracks work, the other two produce either silence with a repetitive metronomic tick or a painful hissing with periodic faint impressions of far-off and possibily inhuman spoken words.
A spacecraft refuel station operated by Ayotimiwa Corp. and OKLG Port Authority. Can refill most onboard resources, including O2, N2, and fusion reactor remass (He3 and Heavy Water)
A kiosk operated by local trade corporations offering an array of bulk-scale trade goods prepared for freight hauling in appropriate cargo pods.
A bureaucratically verified embassy recognized System-wide, allowing legal status applications through a variety of programs.
A ferry request kiosk operated by Pacific Airlines Space Service. For a price, users can request a shuttle to a variety of local destinations, including legally-owned ships.

A resale vending machine full of bits of hull, scrap, nuts, bolts, and cable pulled together for marked up re-sale. Whoever is responsible for operating this kiosk is doing a subpar job, but at least it runs.

A kiosk offering retail sales of ship equipment and niceities for the discerning spacer: Furniture, lighting, decor, consumer electronics, storage solutions, and more.

In the void, life support may keep your body alive, but it's lifestyle goods that let you live.

A kiosk operated by Van Buren Pharmaceuticals offering medical supplies (acute and preventative), surgical or pharmaceutical treatment of scars and some chronic ailments, and outpatient treatments such as nanorobotic first aid to assist general healing.

A work distribution platform managed by Agile Workforce Solutions. Jobs are posted by verified employers and then priced according to a proprietary algorithm. Freelancers pay costs up front to accept a gig.

A semi-automated provider of fresh-prepared meals that nourish your soul as much or more than your belly.

This cart claims to provide the Nigerian flavor profiles and unique spice mixes popularized decades ago by the Ogiso space elevator on old Earth and more recently by K-Leg's infamous asteroid colony and ship graveyard.

A kiosk operated by Ogiso's Registry and Ogiso Bank allowing clients to buy and sell spacecraft, view spacecraft ratings, and replacement transponders for legally registered vessels. Alternate kiosk functions are available to the right and left of the main access panel.
A kiosk operated by real estate corporations and local landlords, allowing clients with legal status to buy and sell residential spaces. Permanent residency or citizenship required.

A kiosk operated by Venus Reclamation Corp, allowing visiting haulers to buy and sell any salvage and wares.

Venus always has a steady demand for hull parts, scrap materials, replacement components, used cargo pods, and anything else a visiting ship can spare.

A kiosk operated by Ayotimiwa Corp. offering an array of small-scale essentials to bolster the productivity of shipbreakers and visiting traders. On offer are maintenance tools, provisions, cargo dollies, replacement spacesuits, hull patches, clothing, and other basics of work and survival.

A kiosk operated by Ayotimiwa Corp. allowing shipbreakers to buy and sell any low-value salvage and wares.

Watchful pickers can find a steady supply of hull segments from various manufacturers stocked daily, as well as scrap metals, specialty replacement components, and the actual nuts and bolts of ship work.

To sell high-value parts, visit the License Kiosk nearby.
Owned and operated by the Ayotimiwa Corporation, this kiosk will buy high value salvage obtained in local space. Requires a temporary license, which can also be purchased at this kiosk.

Lightweight, body-hugging compression pants that can be worn under space suits.

A staple garment for those expecting high-G maneuevers, this design provides slight resistance to G-LOC and strain by preventing blood pooling in the lower extremities while under high-Gs.

A LiOH cartridge designed for use in shipboard atmosphere scrubbers for life support. In an exothermic reaction, LiOH bonds with CO2 from the air to produce lithium carbonate and H2O. Ships require about one cartridge per day for each crew member.

'Osteoclasts are a thing of the past!' This Van Buren-engineered cocktail of bioactive peptides, growth factors, and tailored nanoparticles stimulates both osteoblast activity and protein synthesis and mitochondrial function (to counter atrophy from zero-g living), delivered through a single-use subcutaneous injector pen that works through clothes and thin spacesuits.

One use per day keeps the atrophy away, replacing the need for dedicated daily exercise.
An emergency, single-use device that, once activated by a spring-actuated hammer, chemically generates oxygen from Lithium perchlorate (LiClO4). Most effective in small, stable compartments.

An emergency, single-use device that, once activated by a spring-actuated hammer, chemically generates oxygen from Lithium perchlorate (LiClO4), with an added light for a comforting cosmetic effect. Most effective in small, stable compartments.
Once a definitive garment of the laborer, and later a staple of casual wear, these denim trousers are now something of a luxury item off-Earth.

A 6 oz serving of rich Moretti Coffee, a space-adapted drink famous throughout The System. Often enjoyed from bulbs designed for zero-G drinking with proper aromatics. Not as hydrating as water, and prone to impose caffeine effects. Rich, dark, the way you like it. Have more. Have Moretti.
